description: Apple designs a wide variety of consumer electronic devices, including smartphones, personal computers, tablets, wearables, and accessories.
Microsoft develops and licenses consumer and enterprise software, including Windows operating systems and Office productivity suite.
NVIDIA is a leading manufacturer of graphics processing units for gaming and professional markets.
Amazon is a leading online retailer and cloud service provider with extensive e-commerce operations.
Google is the largest internet search engine and a dominant player in online advertising and cloud computing.
Meta operates social networking platforms including Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp.
Tesla designs and manufactures electric vehicles, energy storage systems, and solar panels.
Broadcom designs and develops semiconductor and infrastructure software solutions.
TSMC is the world's largest dedicated independent semiconductor foundry.
Tencent is a Chinese technology conglomerate specializing in internet services and products.
JPMorgan Chase is a leading global financial services firm and largest bank in the US.
Bank of America provides banking and financial products and services to individual and institutional clients.
Visa operates the world's largest electronic payment network.
Mastercard provides payment processing and technology services worldwide.
PayPal operates an online payments system supporting online money transfers.
Block provides payment and financial services technology for merchants and individuals.
Goldman Sachs is a leading global investment banking and financial services firm.
Morgan Stanley provides financial services including investment banking and wealth management.
American Express provides charge and credit card products and travel-related services.
Intuit develops financial management and tax preparation software for individuals and businesses.
NextEra Energy is the world's largest producer of wind and solar energy.
Enphase Energy designs and manufactures solar micro-inverters for residential solar systems.
First Solar manufactures photovoltaic solar modules using advanced thin film technology.
Vestas designs and manufactures wind turbines for renewable energy production.
Orsted develops and operates offshore wind farms and renewable energy solutions.
Exxon Mobil explores and produces crude oil and natural gas globally.
Chevron engages in petroleum and natural gas exploration and production.
BP is a global integrated oil and gas company with operations in exploration and refining.
TotalEnergies is a French multinational integrated oil and gas company.
Johnson & Johnson develops pharmaceutical products and medical devices.
Pfizer discovers and develops medicines and vaccines for various therapeutic areas.
Merck provides health solutions through prescription medicines and vaccines.
Novartis is a Swiss multinational pharmaceutical company focused on innovative medicines.
Roche is a Swiss pharmaceutical company specializing in diagnostics and pharmaceuticals.
Amgen discovers and develops human therapeutics using advanced cellular biology.
Gilead researches and develops medicines for life-threatening diseases.
Biogen develops therapies for neurological and neurodegenerative diseases.
Regeneron discovers and develops medicines for serious medical conditions.
Moderna develops messenger RNA therapeutics and vaccines.
NIO designs and manufactures premium electric vehicles for the Chinese market.
Rivian develops electric vehicles and accessories for outdoor adventures.
Lucid manufactures luxury electric vehicles with advanced technology.
BYD is a Chinese manufacturer of electric vehicles and rechargeable batteries.
Toyota is the world's largest automotive manufacturer by production volume.
Honda manufactures automobiles and motorcycles globally.
General Motors designs and manufactures vehicles and automotive parts.
Ford designs and manufactures automobiles and commercial vehicles.
Stellantis is a multinational automotive manufacturing corporation.
